bug.short_desc: Enhance the current animation layer with CSS3 animations

long_desc.thetext: Our animation layer is currently completely build with JS. We should take advantage of CSS animations if available. It would be good if you could check if the CSS animations can be used for all animations we currently offer in the framework.

This ons a big one so we should think about how we do it before doing. So could you maybe write a wiki page before that and compare the state of the current animation layer of qooxdoo with the possibility of CSS3 transitions? I would like to know where we can just implement the same functionality with CSS 3 and where we have to change something in the existing layer or keep the old stuff. You can use the already existant animation site and add the CSS3 stuff:
http://qooxdoo.org/documentation/general/animation

Perhaps the new animation Performance API is interesting:
http://www.w3.org/TR/2011/WD-animation-timing-20110602/

Added an animation class which handles the cross browser animation stuff. Also added a little convenience on top of that to make it more usable. See the two demos I added to the bom folder for more details. Also enhanced the feedreaders website view with some animations.
